snippet: The talk show host Rush Limbaugh may soon join Harry S. Truman, Walt Disney and Stan Musial in the Capitol’s Hall of Famous Missourians.
abstract: Democrats and progressive groups are waging an uphill campaign to prevent Rush Limbaugh from being inducted into the Hall of Famous Missourians, contending his legacy of divisiveness and bigotry have no place in the institution; State House speaker Steven Tilley, who has sole discretion over entry, says he is determined to follow through on Limbaugh's induction.
lead_paragraph: The talk show host Rush Limbaugh may soon join Harry S. Truman, Walt Disney and Stan Musial in the Capitol’s Hall of Famous Missourians.

headline.main: Move to Enshrine Limbaugh With Missouri’s Greats Draws Ire
headline.print_headline: Move to Enshrine Limbaugh With Missouri’s Greats Draws Ire
